Reviews.Title: “a surprise”
Reviews.Author: maura A
Reviews.Content: it was a really nice surprise to find such a quiet hotel near a great road as Kurfursterdamm; no noise inside the room; very nice room, with open space and high ceiling, very functional and comfortable furnishing ; the beds and pillows allows a good sleep ; the atmosphere is really relaxing ; the reception people are quite kind and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: TravellerVi
Reviews.Content: I decided to rate Aspria Spa + Sporting Club + Hotel as average. Berlin is quite a big city and the hotel is quite far from the S-bahn and U-bahn. It is a decent place for wellness, but I am not sure it cuts it for a four-star hotel. The room was exquisite, so was the wellness area and the breakfast buffet. I can recommend Angela Schultz as a spa therapist if you would like a facial or a pedicure. The minus: thin walls between the rooms; I could hear the guy in the neighbouring room snoring. There were also a multitude of minor things, a lack of attention to detail. The spa massage therapists did not show up on time; the receptionist in the spa did not ask for enough detail to pick the right treatment, i.e. quick pedicure or a spa pedicure; the wireless network was slow and the codes we first got did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel inside a fitness club”
Reviews.Author: AleksanderD
Reviews.Content: It is not by accident the word "hotel" is last in the name of "Aspria Spa + Sporting Club + Hotel", it is as if they as an afterthought have fitted a few hotel rooms inside a fitness club. Wonderful if you are into fitness and wellness. I found the gym well-equiped, with a 25m swimming pool and multiple rooms for cardio and resitance training. The spa was nice. We had a couple of good massages, and V-- had an excellent facial and pedicure. The saunas are not for the shy though, German rules meaning nudity apply. The hotel rooms were excellent, spacious and modernly designed. The breakfast buffet was good as well. The only bad thing about the place, is that it is not very centrally located, being near the far end of the Ku'damm and quite a distance from the S-bahn. It does not look like it is that far on the map, but it is just the massive Berlin blocks that trick you.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay in Berlin!!”
Reviews.Author: florenz59
Reviews.Content: We found the Aspria Hotel Berlin simply superb! Hotel is in a quiet location just a few steps from Ku-damm and only a short walk to the next S-Bahn Station. Some good restaurants can be found within 10 to 15 mins walk, the nearest one is just around the corner. The hotel itself has a restaurant with a nice atmosphere and moderate prices. The staff was highly professional, helpful and very friendly; we arrived before noon, and they arranged our room to be ready much before the regular check-in time! great! The room was quite spacious and clean, with a modern and functional design, safe, Wi-fi internet (free of charge), large writing desk, really comfortable beds, a very large bathroom (bathrobes and plenty of towels included) and a lot of space for everything. We had a room on the rear court, which was very quiet: no noise at all, neither from outside nor from neighbouring rooms. Breakfast was served in a beautiful "winter garden", and it was excellent. Of course we visited the "club" (entry is included in the room price!) with gym, swimming-pool and spa. The spa on the fifth floor is great, with several saunas, jacuzzi, steam-bath, silent relaxing zones with comfortable beds, and a beautiful open-air terrace with chaises-longues and a small pond. We also enjoyed the "Aufguss" ceremony, which takes place every hour. A fabulous treat! It is also possible to have a light snack and a drink at the spa Bistrot. We can highly recommend this hotel, and would stay there again when in Berlin. Prices are moderate, and it's also possible to find good deals through the on-line reservations, especially in case of early bookings.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation in a quiet part of town”
Reviews.Author: Bertrand X
Reviews.Content: It's a club rather than a hotel: To go to your room you cross either the spa or the gym. It's close to the lower part of Ku'dam (West Berlin), rather quiet (few restaurant) and close to Tegel airport, but you'll have to take a bus/cab or walk 20 min to get to more busy/lively part of town. It's a great relaxing place with very friendly staff! Super value for money.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place I will stay in Berlin from now on!”
Reviews.Author: brother_naxos
Reviews.Content: OK. First, I have never been moved to write a review before. Second, I must admit that I booked the Aspria because it was in the right neighbourhood and I got a really good deal! (By that I don't mean it was dirt cheap - so don't get your hopes up - but that it should have been a lot more; I knew what I wanted in terms of basic facilites and was expecting to pay quite a bit more.) It's a rather uninspiring facade as you see it for the first time and the area is very big-city-urban but, once you get inside the door, that all changes. From the first greeting uttered by the receptionist - and, by the way, my German is OK and my partner is German, but every single member of staff we encountered spoke excellent English - to the farewell from her colleague, through the housekeeping staff and (a special mention to) the spa staff, the service and professionalism was outstanding. The rooms (based on the one I had) are spacious and modern. Some of the quirks - like the open plan ensuite area (the toilet and shower are closed off by translucent glass though) - might not be to all tastes but the decor was clean and well-conceived. And as for the carpet...you'll have to go there, but you must walk around barefoot and scrunch your toes ;o) The bed was incredibly comfortable, although I, personally, would have preferred a double mattress, rather than two singles in a double frame. That, however, is a very minor quibble. Oh, and the shower was one of the best I have ever encountered in a hotel. We didn't eat in the hotel, so I won't comment on that, but we did use the spa and sauna. The sauna area is surprisingly large and well equipped for a hotel (although, as is the norm in Germany, it is expected that you don't wear more than a towel, if that - you have been warned) and, well, I will simply say that my girlfriend (who is a verteran enjoyer of massages) had "the best massage of [my] entire life". Ask for Talia! To round off, I will simply say this: I travel a lot for work, as a touring musician. Good quality sleep and relaxation are paramount in surviving that lifestyle. I have stayed in over 100 hotels in the last 18 months. This was the best. No doubt. I WILL go back...

Reviews.Title: “A hotel and a health club - perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Nusa77
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel and would like to come back again. At the beginning it is a bit difficult to find out where what is, in the end it is a health club with hotel, and not the other way around... but when you find yourself out, then it is a very good experience... Rooms are modern and big, there is sauna, swimming pool, massages, spa, etc... everything you can imagine, and just some steps from your room. And there is even a kindergarden for babies, we didn't try it out (this time) but I guess (hope) it is for hotel guests as well.... The hotel is not in the center of Berlin, but just 5 bus stops from the shopping street Kurfürstendamm, which is great. I Summer you can even walk this distance. By the way, try the restaurant just at the corner (Eiffel), it has great food at a reasonable price, and we were told that Sunday brunch is excellent. We want to try the next time we are there, because we will definitely repeat!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel or a health club?!”
Reviews.Author: Springburn
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel... But it really is more a health club than a hotel. How many hotels have entry barriers?! But it's fantastic. Modern, big rooms, great service and really convenient. I was there on business and ended up here by accident. But I'd go back for leisure or for business. You walk through the health club to get to the hotel but hey - it's got nice carpets and it's incredibly civilised. Great value too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: PalmTreePrincess
Reviews.Content: I go to Berlin for business a few times a year, and this trip was no exception. I've stayed closer to the tourist attractions before and enjoyed being in the heart of all the action, but this time I wanted to be closer to where all of my meetings were - and the Hotel Aspria popped up on the map as only two stops on the S-bahn from the ICC centre - perfect! The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, the bed in the room spacious and comfortable, the shower and bathroom areas spacious and the Kores toiletries fabulous. The Spa itself was absolute heaven! From the Sol inhalation room (a flowing wall of saltwater, surrounded by comfy lounge chairs) to the wave and light room to the Saunas and the hot stones you could rest on, this hotel was exactly what I hoped for and more. My days were long and stressful and being able to come back to a comfortable room, a welcoming reception from the staff, and then spend at least an hour if not two hours in the spa facilities before collapsing into bed - it was absolute heaven. Not only will I book in to this hotel next time I have business in Berlin, but I'm trying to convince some friends of ours to go for a long weekend next time we are close to Germany. It would be well worth it. *Warning to the Americans though, if you've never been in a European spa, make sure you know about the nudity so that you aren't too shocked. I'd been to spas in Europe before, but my colleague who was American and hadn't been was a bit shocked on the first day. The staff were very good about explaining the extra levels of security and measures taken to make sure it was all respectable and where nudity was acceptable and where it wasn't, and by day three she was full of confidence and in the sauna with the natives!

Reviews.Title: “very good for a city break”
Reviews.Author: BEYEDB
Reviews.Content: Good spot for a city break - very clean - didn`t use the spa but it looked like it would be v good.The pool was a reasonable size.Good breakfast in a pleasant restaurant area - quite a few restaurants around especially as you go into the centre - u bahn is about 7 to 10 mins walk.All round I would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to recharge your batteries”
Reviews.Author: 60degrees
Reviews.Content: This was a great find. The hotel is very modern and comfortable. The room was spacious and quiet. The spa is excellent with several choices of sauna and steam room. On a Saturday evening, there is a sauna master who gets the sauna to a very hot temperature, so take an bucket of ice in with you to keep your head cool. After the spa, I came out very refreshed. The breakfast in the morning was excellent. The only criticism I would make is that the rooms are quite a distance from the reception and spa.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for relaxing, working out and enjoying the cool city”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette1980
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, in the vest side of Berlin. We loved the training facilities, the workout classes where good with welcoming instructors with one exception (don`t try hip hop!!!). The spa treatments wonderful, the spa area I’m sure is nice but not to our taste. Location is ok, but you need to use the busses, trains or subway to get to most of the city (Brandenburger tor is a 2,5 hour walk away). Don’t think we ever waited for more than 2 min for the bus. Only small negative thing is that the room cleaning could be better (hair in the shower that did not belong to us) . They also forgot to give us soap, slippers and toilet paper. We would also like a place to sit down after a long day out. Since there are no chairs and no bedcover, you need to sit directly on the bed linens. Overall a good experience and we would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel in Berlin with a proper fitness centre”
Reviews.Author: LondonTelegramSam
Reviews.Content: This is actually a fitness centre so the title should come as no surprise. Great rooms and beds. Having to go through the turnstyle each time you want to go from your room to somewhere else is a bit of a pain but on the whole it is a great place, clean and modern with good service and the best spa/sauna area I have ever been to (and it is free for guests!).

Reviews.Title: “Excelent vacation for body and mind.”
Reviews.Author: primak
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding opportunity both to visit and to rest. The rooms are spacious, sports facilities are enormous breakfast is good and all in the western part of the city. The only challenge is the distance from public transportaion.

Reviews.Title: “Superb sports facilities with top class hotel attached”
Reviews.Author: chrisknut
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I spent 4 nights here at a trade fair and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The staff were very welcoming and helpful, the rooms are top class and the spa and sports facilities are second to none. It was a shame we were in Berlin on business! Every detail of the decor has been carefully chosen to provide a harmonious whole - as befitting a spa where relaxing and tranquillity should be the key. The hotel is located only 10 mins by taxi from the Messe area, although the walk to the S-bahn station to get downtown is an energetic 10 mins. I will definitely return - next time hopefully with more spare time to enjoy a class or two and not just the excellent pool.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, relaxing and close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Tomi2914
Reviews.Content: Excellent fitness and gym for both, aerobic and anaerobic excersice. Rooms very nice, mdern but still perfectly comfortable. Free cable internet in rooms. Staff very nice. A perfect choice if you chose doing sport or relax after business. Restaurants in surrondings 10 minutes walk. Way to the airport is clearly signed. However breakfest might be more rich. Summing up I recommend this hotel. Actually after my discovery of Aspria in last November I have not slept in any other hotel in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “very good price for a design hotel with pool and spa”
Reviews.Author: ipnovel
Reviews.Content: pro: I had a short but very pleasant stay in Berlin in this hotel, very kind people, nice room, nice swimming pool and fitness centre, near all the most interesting places in Berlin cons: breakfast not so wonderfull

Reviews.Title: “great place to be”
Reviews.Author: 1travellerBrussels
Reviews.Content: as a memeber of La Rasant Fitness Center in Brussels I came across this hotel facility in Berlin. Nice setup for up to a weeks stay, easy access to the fitness center and very pleasnat staff. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & luxurious”
Reviews.Author: QuintenAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Pro's: beautiful and spacious room, great bed with the TV attached to the ceiling (how decadent), small fridge in the room, quiet room, safe, excellent food at reasonable prices, free use of luxurious spa, swimming-pool and gym, bath-robes & slippers provided in the room. Con's: Internet (no WiFi in the room, the LAN connection didn't work (couldn't figure out why because no problem at other locations) and the 2 free desktops at the reception didn't work perfectly either (to complicated to explain), a bit remote location, but the frequent bus service to the city centre makes it OK. Summarized: perfect place for a relaxing and luxurious stay. Internet service needs improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect both for wark & relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Philippe1963
Reviews.Content: The spacious, bright and quiet room with direct access to the great spa facilities, was the perfect place to work and to relax, during, and especially after, the OEB conference. The staff is friendly and efficient despite the fact that the hotel activities started about seven weeks ago. (The reason to skip two minor mix ups.) The location, in the "old West," has less to offer than Mitte but the S-Bahn (which takes you to Hauptbahnhof, Friedrich St or Hackescher Markt in no time) is an 8 minute walk away. Philippe, Brussels
